title: 104_hr1565
content: AUTHORITY TO PROVIDE PRIORITY HEALTH CARE. Authorized Inpatient Care for herbicide-exposed veterans includes hospital and nursing home care for diseases linked to herbicide exposure as determined by the National Academy of Sciences. The text chunk discusses the criteria for determining a disease as linked to herbicide exposure in humans, based on available evidence and research studies. The text chunk outlines eligibility criteria for hospital care and nursing home care for radiation-exposed veterans with diseases linked to ionizing radiation exposure. The text chunk defines eligibility criteria for herbicide-exposed veterans who served in Vietnam during the Vietnam era and may have been exposed to herbicide agents. The text chunk expands eligibility for outpatient care to include radiation-exposed veterans for specified diseases before January 1, 1998. The text chunk amends eligibility for outpatient care for radiation-exposed veterans with specified diseases. The provisions of sections 1710(e) and 1712(a) of title 38, United States Code, continue to apply for veterans receiving care for presumed exposure to substances or radiation. Passed by the House of Representatives on June 27, 1995.
